9bfe80350ba3.title: I find this article to be lacking in any and all self awareness.

paragraphs.text: I find this article to be lacking in any and all self awareness. Adria claims to have been mortally offended by the sexualization of the word “dongle” so much so that she had to publically twitter shame these men. Adria herself on twitter publically used sexually graphic language, and made lewd jokes way above and beyond the bounds of the “dongle” joke that she claimed offended her.
paragraphs.name: 1ce9

9927885bf026.title: There have been countless studies that show that being attractive (both men and women) gives…

paragraphs.text: There have been countless studies that show that being attractive (both men and women) gives certain advantages — unless you’re working in Tech, apparently (as an attractive woman). Which makes some sense: most of the male co-workers in Tech tend to be geeks who haven’t had much female interaction in their lives.
paragraphs.name: 760e

paragraphs.text: Adria was brave, doing what she thought was right. It can be tough though, finding the right volume at which to speak. I doubt the loss of jobs were her intention at the time (certainly not her own).
paragraphs.name: 1a1d

paragraphs.text: For anyone that wants to take this author seriously — you should take a look at what Adria Richards did .
Shame on the author for playing loose with the facts in order to progress her social justice warrior agenda at all costs.

57f8256ed745.title: I’m a 50+ year old veteran/doctor who experienced harassment and sexism (and know there was much…

paragraphs.text: I’m a 50+ year old veteran/doctor who experienced harassment and sexism (and know there was much worse for some women) in the US Army of the 80s-90s. My daughter is an engineer at NASA flourishing and apparently not running into anything like that (I keep worrying any kind mentor might just be creeping on her). FOund the tech/ women in tech articles…
paragraphs.name: 0e6b

virtuals.subtitle: Anyway thanks for this and other articles and if anyone has dirt on NASA as well please share it!

content.subtitle: Anyway thanks for this and other articles and if anyone has dirt on NASA as well please share it!

paragraphs.name: a618

virtuals.subtitle: Four years after #Donglegate, we’re finally ready to believe women.

content.subtitle: Four years after #Donglegate, we’re finally ready to believe women.

paragraphs.text: When will you get it. Men and women communicate differently. Men will say the meanest nastiest things to each other because we think it’s funny. Both in jest and in seriousness. Women will speak as they see fit to one another but in no way does it resemble the way men communicate. Let men be men.
paragraphs.name: dfb6

virtuals.subtitle: You come barreling in to a work space/school created by men, through Affirmative Action, and expect to be treated the same way. Then you…

6ae507f1ae9d.title: In the Richards case, she could have gradually escalated the matter, such as speaking to the…

paragraphs.text: In the Richards case, she could have gradually escalated the matter, such as speaking to the offending men first, instead of publicly humiliating them with her tweet. Including their picture in the tweet without first understanding the context of the men’s statements, or finding out more about who they were, was too much and rather bitchy. Maybe she…
paragraphs.name: f5af

fc7e6fc1a7fe.title: She had no right to post that pic.

paragraphs.text: She had no right to post that pic. She could have just tweeted and left out the pic and left it at that. The guys weren’t talking about her, they were just making guy jokes. She is the reason why it is hard for men to want to work with women.
paragraphs.name: 6f75

8b9e1dc19361.title: Well that cartoon says it all about women in tech.

paragraphs.text: Well that cartoon says it all about women in tech. She is banging on the door as if she is locked out when all she has to do is lift the plank and walk in. LMFAO!
paragraphs.name: 07a6
